p: Origanum vulgare is an herbal plant that has been used as food flavoring agent in many countries [ Figure 1]. It has strong antiseptic and antimicrobial activity due to the presence of carvacrol and thymol, both phenolic compounds which directly inhibit germination and hyphal formation in Candida. Its antifungal actions have been found to be similar to nystatin and amphotericin B. A study in mice has shown to cure systemic candidiasis on a daily oral administration of 1.0 Î¼l of O. vulgare essential oil for 30 days.[ 17] In human beings, the antifungal activities of O. vulgare have been studied against the Candida isolated from sources of various systemic conditions.[ 4 17 18] However, no study is available in the literature that has explored its possible anti-candidal activity against oral isolates of Candida that cause CADS.
